key_channel_insights.line_content: 81 % of itineraries price higher on OTAs than the VA site, averaging a 4 % mark-up despite a slight month-on-month decline.
Metasearch undercuts the website on 85 % of fares, peaking at 95 % inside seven days and posing the largest direct-revenue leakage.
82 % of GDS fares carry a 4–5 % premium, yet parity has inched up to 17 % after recent pricing fixes.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: 81 % of fares list higher on OTAs than direct, with a 4 % average mark-up.
Exact fare alignment improved to 16.7 %, a 2.9-point gain month-on-month.
‘Not found’ dropped to 1.8 %, cutting lost-sale risk tied to missing content.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Share slipped marginally WoW, yet eight in ten itineraries still carry a premium.
Parity rose 2.9 pts MoM but remains well below best-practice thresholds.
Discounted OTA fares are rare and shallow (-12 % on average).

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Domestic routes replicate the 81 % OTA-higher pattern, confirming a network-wide issue.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: AU-origin searches show identical 81 % OTA-higher share and 4 % premium.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: OTA-higher share climbs to 78 %, increasing mismatch at peak purchase urgency.
86 % OTA-higher with a 5 % premium, though improving 4.8 pts WoW.

mse_highlights.line_content: 85 % of fares are cheaper on MSE, eroding direct sales.
‘Same price’ rose 2.4 pts MoM to 14 %, signalling early recovery.
Undercutting peaks at 95 % in the 0-7-day window.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Share eased 2.5 pts MoM but still dominates pricing outcomes.
Parity improves slowly; one in seven searches now matches direct pricing.
Operational gap remains negligible but ticked up slightly WoW.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: 85 % MSE-lower mirrors the network average, confirming system-wide leak.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: AU searches show 85 % MSE-lower; parity up 0.7 pts WoW but still low.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 95 % of close-in fares are cheaper on MSE; parity just 5 %.
Undercutting falls to 68 %; parity improves to 31 %.

gds_highlights.line_content: 82 % of itineraries show higher GDS prices with a 4–5 % uplift.
Parity rose to 17 %, a 3-pt MoM gain.
‘Not found’ reduced to 0 %, closing previous availability gaps.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Premium eased 2 pts MoM but still drives most comparisons.
Parity advanced 3 pts MoM; variation remains within 1 %.
Under-pricing cases continue to shrink, limiting arbitrage.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: 82 % higher-priced, 17 % parity; pattern consistent across routes.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: GDS higher share holds at 82 % with a 4 % premium; parity up 3 pts MoM.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: GDS higher rises to 80 % with a 4 % uplift; parity slides to 19 %.
Higher-priced share dips to 86 % (-5 pts WoW); parity reaches 14 %, premium 5 %.
